page.title: 05Walgrave belt factory
page.content: The main employer in Walgrave is the Regent Belt Company's leather belt factory. The factory exports 60% of its products.The places the belts go to include U.S.A.,France,Germany,Italy, Australia,Singapore,Japan,Hong Kong and the Middle East.The factory makes approx. 20,000 a week .Seventy people are employed, thirty three of them are from Walgrave. Recently it has won the Queen's Award for Industry.All materials come from England,mostly from Liverpool. The Walkers built the original building as a shoe factory in 1899.They've recognised their belts on many famous people including Cliff Richard, Harry Secombe,Paul Newman and Charles Bronson.
